about_the_game:
Music-making is at its best a collaborative process and the music to Farewell North is a definite example of that. Therefore, there are a number of people to thank for making this score possible.

Firstly a huge thank you goes to all the wonderful musicians whose musical sensitivity and dedication brought this score to life. Kostantina Ventouri Roussou (flute/alto flute/piccolo), Maria Skandali (cello), Mislav Rezic (guitar), Sandro Friedrich (pipes), Siobhan Miller (vocals), and of course, Dan Safford (fiddle/violins/viola), who had a particularly outsized impact on this score. It is safe to say that without their involvement and commitment to this music and story, Farewell North would have been a lot poorer.

I also want to thank Joel for bearing with me through the (seemingly never-ending) process of producing a 3-hour long score, helping me realise my vision through those hundreds (of thousands) of tiny iterations that make all the difference, and delivering an end result that sounds better than I could ever have imagined.

Finally, the most important thank you of all goes to Kyle, who kindly trusted me with this very special, touching game and gifted me with what has been one of the deepest, most meaningful and gratifying collaborations I have had the pleasure of being a part of. Knowing how important this project is to him, it is unbelievable how creatively open and welcoming was to me these past few years. His beautiful story alone was more than enough to make this a dream game to work on, but it was his passion and unwavering support of my deep involvement in the development process that left me most wanting to rise to the occasion and try to capture the emotional core of this story as earnestly as I possibly could. And, having spent a few cherished years living in Edinburgh myself, visiting the Highlands and sharing a flat with a little pal, Farewell North hit quite close to home.

Music by John Konsolakis

Mixed & Mastered by Joël Dollié

Fiddle / Violins / Viola: Dan Safford
Cello: Maria Skandali
Uilleann Pipes / Scottish Highland Pipes: Sandro Friedrich
Flute / Alto Flute / Piccolo: Kostantina Ventouri Roussou
Acoustic Guitar: Mislav Rezic

“My Heart’s in the Highlands” vocals performed by Siobhan Miller
Original lyrics by Robert Burns
Engineered by Euan Burton
Supported by National Lottery funding through Creative Scotland

Special Thanks:

Marietta Kandilaki
Harry Andre Katsillis
Humphrey

… and to all of you for listening

name: Farewell North Soundtrack
short_description: Relive the emotional tale of Farewell North through its lush, orchestral soundtrack: featuring fiddle, bagpipes, and two unique renditions of Robert Burns’ “My Heart’s in the Highlands” with vocals by the richly celebrated Scottish folk singer, Siobhan Miller.
